result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant not available by video for the preliminary hearing 10/31/2022; date has been changed to 11/8/2022 at 10:30 am. Parties are notified by email.

Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney not in court, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones appeared by video for Mark Anthony Dabney.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Mr Dabney was moved from Dodge to Red Granite and not scheduled to appear by video from the new institution.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Mark A. Dabney - #162147, Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 700, Waupun WI 53963-0700).
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Mark A. Dabney - #162147, Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 700, Waupun WI 53963-0700).

Case set for a preliminary hearng on 10/6/22 at 10:00 am. Defendant is at Dodge Correctional and Dodge does not have availability to conduct the zoom hearing. Preliminary hearing moved to 10/7/22 at 10:15 am. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney not in court, in custody.  Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court for Mark Anthony Dabney.  Attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests a preliminary hearing. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Thomas R. Reed in court, defendant Mark Anthony Dabney not in court, in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a State v. Lee hearing. Attorney Reed provides an update to the Court. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; granted.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a state v. lee hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT

Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion from Defendant (Mark Debney  #005651 8885 S 68th St.  Frankin, WI 53131)

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR.29
Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tammie A A-T

Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Mark Anthony Dabney in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark Anthony Dabney appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
